intro: Auricula-ursi pedemontana, commonly known as the Alpine bear's ear, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, ear-shaped leaves that resemble the ears of a bear. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white, blooming in the summer months. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous habitats. Due to its rarity and specific environmental requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in some regions.
